memberDescription: [u"Prolific traveler for the last 35 years. Originally from the UK, lived in Canada and now in North Carolina. Service and quality is key for me (that's why I left the UK!!) I visit restaurants across the whole spectrum available and judge them based on that fact. With accommodations, I measure in 2 criteria, the first being how it shapes up against description when booking and the actual experience when there. I use tripadvisor to plan my travel, and so, give an honest review to assist others. Some suppliers will like my comments, some won't, but that's just tough, the customers are the only people who matter!! "]
ownerdesc: This is the place to come if you're looking for a sophisticated crowd. The music is less frenzied, and you might even manage a conversation. The dance area is a loftlike space. review:

memberDescription: [u'I\'d say I\'m an amateur traveler. I haven\'t ventured to very many places, but I do have the desire to. As much as I try to save a buck, I don\'t mind splurging here and there. I\'m a typical tourist and love the major landmarks, but I can\'t stand being on someone else\'s schedule, so I rarely take tours.\nThanks to the Food Network, I\'m always looking for local fare and love sharing my opinions and experiences for other future patrons.\nWhen traveling, I often say to myself "I did not pay \'X\' dollars to come here and do what I can do back home". So, I try to find activities, adventures and experiences that are native to where I\'m visiting. The best way I find is by chatting with the locals and staff of any establishment. They usually know the best spots that aren\'t infested by tourists and that preserve the local experience. ']
review:
Went on a Saturday night. The MC and all 3 acts were impressive. I'd recently went to Yuk Yuks in Niagara and the caliber of comedians at Absolute by far surpass Yuk Yuks. name: MrRichard7
CitiesVisited: Toronto, Ontario, Canada,
ownerdesc: For a decade now, Lula Lounge distinguished itself as Torontos home for groundbreaking Latin, Jazz and World Music. Our audience reflects our programming - The crowd at Lula is one of the most diverse, friendly, and multi-generational and multi-ethnic crowds in the city, what ties them together is love of music, having a good time, drinking, dinning and dancing!Friday and Saturday night Lula presents the city's top Salsa bands, Djs and Dance Instructors. The friendly beginner's lesson is great way to break the ice, no partner necessary. For a great night out the $49 package is recommend, it includes a 3 course dinner.Sunday's from 11-2 there's a Family Cuban Brunch with Lice Cuban music, a brunch Buffet and Dance Class. Sunday through Thursday evening you can experience anything from Chamber Music to Blues, Spoken Word to Tuvan Throat Singers, South Asian to Goth, check out ww.lula.ca for the schedule!
review:
A great place in an interesting part of Toronto.
The service was great and the music and dancing was amazing.
We will be back soon for some more for sure.

ownerdesc: Queen Tour is a premium tour operator from Toronto. We offer fully escorted and commentated sightseeing tours of Niagara Falls. All of our tour guides have over 25 years of experience and are extremely punctual, knowledgeable, friendly, entertaining and most importantly safe drivers.

name: urbanfoodie
CitiesVisited: Toronto, Ontario, Canada,Montreal, Quebec, Canada,Amsterdam, The Netherlands,Madrid, Spain,Ghent, Belgium,Paris, France,Seville, Spain,Lubeck, Germany,New York City, NY, USA,Barcelona, Spain,Prague, Czech Republic,Brussels, Belgium,
memberDescription:
[u'I absolutely love real food, culture and old architecture. I'm a big fan of Europe. So far my favourite countries are Spain and Belgium. After travelling for a bit now, I find myself gravitating toward smaller cities. At the end of the day, though, for me, it's all about the people. If the locals aren't welcoming, then everything else is rendered worthless.
I don't really find beach holidays appealing, I spent lots of my summer holidays on the beach in Trinidad and find it pretty boring after a day or so.
I prefer honest, down to earth, non-touristy places and restaurants.
I am fiercely proud to live in Toronto and really couldn't see myself living anywhere else.
Best so far: Breakfast on the rooftop of Hotel Amadeus in Seville, Dinner at "In De Gloria" in Antwerp, Tapas bar hopping in Madrid and the "Normandy In a Plate" menu at La Couronne in Rouen.
Least favourite: London, Paris and Lubeck, Germany. So disappointed!!! I really wanted to like them. ']
ownerdesc: Le Dolci - Located in downtown Toronto our goal is to bring fun, foodie education to the city. Join us for sweet classes including: cupcake, cake pops, cake and cookie decorating classes. Classes are two hours, hands-on & full of icing sugar fun!Participants leave with a sweet parcel of their creations as a tasty souvenir of the experience.
review: So glad I went to the Parisian Macarons class. Learned so much about technique and really enjoyed the laid back vibe. Looking forward to returning.

memberDescription: [u'I share the Rick Steves philosophy - travel like a local. I want to see all the sights first. I seek business-travel accommodations (must have clean bathroom, room safe, accessibility to public transit) - anything else is a waste, since that room is only to sleep in and store my belongings. I prefer travelling by myself since my friends cannot keep up with my pace, but I will do day tours in groups to cover multiple small towns in a single day. When it comes to restaurants, I seek value above all else; so I will take a good brasserie or buffet over a fancy sit-down dinner most times. ']

ownerdesc: This group mounts unique, visually fantastic "black light" shows. Famous People Players is renowned not just for the quality of its shows, but also for bringing out the creative potential in performers with disabilities. The price of the show includes a four-course dinner.
review: Six of us attended a luncheon showing and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The food (chicken dinner) was excellent and the salad and accompanying vegetables were perfect. I enjoy sharing the culture with the locals in many of the countries I go to, so i stay in hotels and eat in restaurants off the beaten path to always get a sense of the culture and the people, however, I do select some of the nicest hotels and restaurants when traveling as well.\nIn one year, I visited 38 American cities, and 12 countries, as an all time high for me. ownerdesc: The Second City is renown as the world's premier comedy theatre, with critically-acclaimed live improv and sketch comedy shows on stage every night. Located in the heart of Toronto's Entertainment District, The Second City's intimate cabaret theatre offers table service of a affordable bar and food menu, as well as pre-show dinner packages. Enjoy a night of laughs and up-to-the-minute satire from the legendary comedy troupe that inspired Saturday Night Live, SCTV, and Whose Line Is It Anyway! The Second City's list of alumni include entertainment legends such as Martin Short, Eugene Levy, Gilda Radner, John Candy, Andrea Martin, Mike Myers, Colin Mochrie, and hundreds of others. Tickets are only $12 - $29, making The Second City the best entertainment value in Toronto.
review: We had a great night at Second City. The sketches were great but the improv at the end was the best. They are truly professionals! Service was great, table was in the back and we still had a good view. Fun!

Well worth the drive, keep it up!!!!

memberDescription: [u"I live in Lake County, Florida which is pretty much the center of central Florida. It's a great starting point for exploring my favorite state. I love motorcycles and do most journeys via bike. I love to travel out of state also. Born and raised on the east coast, that is what I am familiar with. Slowly exploring the west. Been overseas once. Toured the holy lands of Israel. Amazing trip. Planning a trip now to Isle of Man (my Mecca) for the TT in June 2015. Totally stoked for this adventure! Until then, I will be exploring my state on weekend rides. So much to see, so little time! "]
review: Amazing park with history that dates back to the 1800's. The grounds and gardens are beautifully maintained. There are six greenhouses with tropical plants from all over the world, even cacti. My favorites were the hibiscus. Great place to find sanctuary from the city. The bonus is.. Admission is FREE! Definitely worth a visit.

The Princess of Wales is the first privately owned and financed theatre built in Canada since 1907 - and the first anywhere in North America in over 30 years. ownerdesc: The Princess of Wales Theatre is a new, 2000-seat playhouse built by the father and son producing team of David and Ed Mirvish, just a block away from their historic Royal Alexandra Theatre. The Princess of Wales is the first privately owned and financed theatre built in Canada since 1907 - and the first anywhere in North America in over 30 years. Construction began on August 6, 1991, and the building opened to the public with the musical Miss Saigon on May 26, 1993.The theatre was built with maximum flexibility in mind. Its stage is one of the widest and deepest in North America - large enough to accommodate the most spectacular theatrical productions - and its technical facilities are state-of-the-art.2013/2014 Season:LES MISERABLES Begins Sept 27, 2013THE LION KING April 30 - June 15, 2014THE BOOK OF MORMON Begins Sept 16, 2014
review: Just had a great evening at the Book of Mormon. We didn't have expensive tickets since we were late in booking but our view from the front upper balcony on the side turned out to be just fine.

ownerdesc: Founded in 1922, the Toronto Symphony Orchestra is one of Canadas leading cultural institutions. Today, more than 225,000 patrons and over 50,000 students visit the Orchestra at Roy Thomson Hall each year, and an additional five million Canadians tune in to concert broadcasts on CBC Radio. Under the leadership of Music Director Peter Oundjian, the Orchestra has increased recording and touring projects to include a self-produced record label, and performances throughout the US and Canada. The Orchestra continues to develop its international presence by being an active commissioning body for new Canadian and international works, as well as attracting distinguished guest artists and conductors to performances at Roy Thomson Hall.
review: The Toronto Symphony is always an evening of memorable music & entertainment. The conductors love to explain their choices for the evening & it is so much fun to see the live musicians & their instruments. You can see the rapture of the music as they play it, & at times fun & exhuberance.
